issue.title: §[container.alloc.reqmts] The value category of v should be claimed

blockquote.p: […] an expression v of type T or const T, […]
T is Cpp17CopyInsertable into X means that, in addition to T being Cpp17MoveInsertable into X, the following expression is well-formed:

discussion.p: So, what is the value category of the expression v? We didn't explicitly phrase the wording. The intent may be that the value category of v is any defined value category in , however, the intent is not clear in the current wording. Maybe, we can say:

blockquote.p: for v of any value category.

discussion.p: which can make the intent meaning clearer.

li.p: (2.3) — T is Cpp17MoveInsertable into X means that the following expression is well-formed:

and its evaluation causes the following postcondition to hold: The value of *p is equivalent to the value of rv before the evaluation.
[Note 1: rv remains a valid object. Its state is unspecified — end note]
(2.4) — T is Cpp17CopyInsertable into X means that, in addition to T being Cpp17MoveInsertable into X, the following expression is well-formed for v of any value category:
and its evaluation causes the following postcondition to hold: The value of v is unchanged and is equivalent to *p.
